intro: Ageratina angustifolia, commonly known as white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fluffy white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Ageratina angustifolia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and attracts various pollinators.
